tasks.task: Farming Seaweed for Environmental and Economic Benefits
subtasks: Growing seaweed on oyster lines in Moreton Bay
Producing 125 kilograms of seaweed equivalent to 10,000 sushi rolls
Attaching small seaweed plants to nets and oyster lines
Cultivating seaweed in a joint project with the University of the Sunshine Coast and Urban Utilities
Assessing potential diversification from oyster farming to seaweed cultivation
Exploring seaweed's uses beyond sushi, including cattle feed and sustainable packaging
Addressing challenges of oyster farming due to climate change and disease risk
Noting the global seaweed industry and Australia's potential for billion-dollar growth within two decades
Recognizing environmental benefits such as nitrogen uptake
Considering scalability for large-scale commercial viability in Moreton Bay
